name: ITP - Pavement Renewal
template name: ITP - SH39 Cannon Rd - Pavement Renewal

name: Part 1 - Pre-commencement Activities (Construction Manager, who has the authority to stop the works at a Hold Point)
DETAIL - Ensure that the Design & Renewal Quality Plan, including the Method of Work Plan and this ITP, have been approved by NZTA
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Review and approve (NZTA Hold Point)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - MS 5.3.2. Pavement Rehabilitation Design & Appendices 6.1 Guide to Auditing Opavement and Surfacing Renewals
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - RQP approval by NZTA

DETAIL - Pre-commencement walkover with the Client, Pavement Design, Construction Manager, Asset Manager and Site Supervisor to ensure the design addresses all known issues, including the clearance envelopes for overhead structures, vegetation and safety system heights e.g. barriers; and confirmation of construction methodology and TTM
FREQUENCY - One month prior to commencement
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Visual inspection
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Confirmation of design and construction methodology
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - ITP Signed and Walkover Notes sighted
DETAIL - Set-out design centreline and check extents of formation (pegs to be installed every 20m)
○ Confirm that the proposed area is within 5% of that agreed to with NZTA. If not, Asset Engineer to agree new area with NZTA, prior to proceeding.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Design
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Tolerance for set-out to be sub-base -25mm/+5mm and basecourse -5mm/+15mm (TNZ B/2)
○ Within ±5% of area previously agreed with NZTA
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - ITP signed & survey set-out records sighted
○ Evidence of revised area agreed to by NZTA if >5% change
○ Undercut to 515mm if less than 5 blows per 100mm. 360mm GAP65 (180+180mm GAP65)
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Design (NZTA Hold Point)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - NZTA B/2, B/5, B/6 or B/7, whichever is applicable
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Design info from approved Design Report entered into this sheet & ITP signed
DETAIL - Materials & Stabilising Agents: Supply & Stockpiling
○ Basecourse, subbase, modified materials & cement meets specification & stockpiled correctly
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Testing, review & submit to NZTA (NZTA Hold Point)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - NZTA M/3, M/4 & TNZ B/5 Modified Mix (ITS, TSR, OWC & MDD)
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Laboratory Test results attached
DETAIL - Written confirmation that all the activities listed in the Method of Work Plan - A. Pre-commencement Activities are completed
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Review
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - This ITP Signed
Part 2 - Pavement Construction (Pavement / Site Engineer, who has the authority to stop the works at a Hold Point)
○ pre-hoeing or pre-milling e.g. high spots or where depth of surfacing matrix is required to be reduced (Stabilisations)
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Visual
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Appendix F: RQP for Pavement Renewals - 4. Inspection and Test Plans C. Overlays
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - This ITP Signed
○ Ensure uncompacted thickness does not exceed the specified limits, including tapers
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Visual & measure
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - TNZ B/2 7.3 Layer Thickness & 7.4 Tapers
Average uncompacted thickness of any layer
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - This ITP Signed & Delivery Dockets supplied
○ Plateau Density Testing (using heavy vibe roller with NDM using Direct Transmission with the material at OWC)
○ Use the greater of Plateau Density or Laboratory MDD
○ To be repeated if any changes occur to establish new target MDD
○ No need to plateu for smaller areas i.e. < 500m2. Visual assessment of layer compaction and surfacing to be used.
Record plant for each Plateau Testing stage:

FREQUENCY - Minimum 1/day or 1/1,000 m2 per treatment depth (whichever is the higher frequency), and per noticeable change in material or per shift, unless Principal agrees to a lower frequency, but ≥ 1/day or 1/2,000m2 per treatment depth (whichever is the higher frequency)
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Measure and record
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - TNZ B/2 7.5 Testing for Layer Compaction (G)
○ Laboratory Results for MDD & OWC (CS & FBS)
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Record:
No. of high amplitude vibe primary passes
No. of low amplitude vibe primary passes
DETAIL - MDD and Moisture Content Testing

○ Bulk sample taken on site below NDM using Direct Transmission during plateau testing for measuing the MDD and the Moisture Content. MC to be corrected in NDM for testing on Day 2 or as soon as available.
FREQUENCY - Minimum 1 per 5,000m2 per treatment depth, and per noticeable change in material or per shift
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Testing (NZTA Hold Point)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - TNZ B/5 7.7 Bulk sample taken at NDM testing locations to measure MDD and OWC
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Plateau Testing Sheet, Laboratory Test Results for MDD & OWC

○ Ensure compaction targets are being met if not, stop and review equipment, compaction methodology and water content. NDM Testing to be Back Scatter for <= 100mm & Direct Submission for > 100mm. In addition, the 'squeeze' test can be used to monitor water content.
FREQUENCY - 5 tests per 1,000m2 randomly to confirm compliance (final test at pre-seal stage by lab)
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Visual & Testing (NZTA Inspection Point)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - TNZ B/2 7.6 Acceptance criteria for stabilised layer compaction (CS & FBS)
○ Avg. >= 98% MDD and Min. >= 95% MDD (based on plateau)
○ Adjust if Subbase to align with TNZ B/6
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - NDM Record Sheet
DETAIL - Control of Levels and Evenness of Surface

○ Check evenness: Measure with straight edge, Roadroid App (using mobile phone in vehicle), a roughometer (e.g. ARRB Roughometer from Fulton Hogan Canterbury Technical Services), Walking Profiler or a drive through to check smooth ride
○ Check levels: Survey measure, including total station, or stringline checks to ensure compliance with design levels & shape, including the clearance to structures
FREQUENCY - Every 20m (Tolerance = -10mm / +10mm over 3m; Basecourse with asphalt -15mm +5mm; Basecourse with chipseal -5mm +15mm; Lip of concrete channel ±5mm)
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Measure
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Stringline and Straight Edge Checksheet
○ Ensure full surface width is trafficked to aid compaction. Move cones every hour or as required. (G only)

○ Ensure constant active Traffic Management to shift the vehicles from side to side until the surface has cured sufficient to sustain the traffic loading. This can vary from a few hours (when windy and sunny) to 24 hours if wet and calm. (CS & FBS only)
○ Maintain OWC: Ensure surface is kept damp but not wet during trafficking.
○ Apply running course and drag-brooming, as required to 'cut' out any fatty areas and to protect the surface
FREQUENCY - Immediately after initial stabilising (CS & FBS only) and primary compaction (CS, FBS & G)
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Visual inspection
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - TNZ B/2 10. Running Course
○ Pavement Construction blue book, section 6. Finishing the Basecourse
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - This ITP Signed
DETAIL - Final Surface Shape, Levels and Roughness

○ Check evenness: Measure with straight edge; check roughness (using, for example, Roadroid App, using mobile phone in vehicle), a roughometer (e.g. ARRB Roughometer from Fulton Hogan Cantebury Technical Services), Walking Profiler or a drive through to check smooth ride, remembering that compliance criteria is applied 12 months after construction

○ Check levels: Survey measure, including total station, or stringline checks to ensure compliance with design levels & shape, including the clearance envelopes for overhead structures, vegetation and safety system heights e.g. barriers
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Measure
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - TNZ B/2 7.7 Surface shape (G), shape (CS & FBS)
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Stringline and Straight Edge Checksheet and / or Total Station Grader Benching Sheet
○ Roughness measurements and / or drive through recorded
○ Crossfall to be checked transverse to the centreline. Crossfall taken > 2m apart to be within ±0.5% of design.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Measure
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - This ITP signed

○ Check that surface is form, well-compacted an dready for sealing i.e. a stony mosaic surface with stones and fines visible, after sweeping (possible use of Clegg Hammer to confirm surface tightness)
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Visual and measure
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - TNZ B/2 7.8 Surface finish (G)
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Pre-seal Handover sheet + Photograph(s) of swept site
DETAIL - Pre-sealing Requirements – Wet / dry density, water content (degree of saturation)
○ Offset determined for specific stabilising agent content i.e. cement and / or lime
FREQUENCY - Prior to sealing 5 tests per 1,000m2
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Testing (NZTA Holding Point)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - TNZ B/2 7.6 Acceptance Criteria for Pavement Layer Compaction (G)
○ TNZ B/5 7.7.1 Acceptance criteria for stabilised layer compaction (CS & FBS)
○ DOS to be less than 60%, if design traffic loading > 5x10^6 ESAs; otherwise 65%
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Pre-seal Handover Sheet
DETAIL - Check service covers are at correct finished design level.
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Measure
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - This ITP signed
DETAIL - Provide NZTA the opportunity to inspect
○ No sealing if fog, rain, wet road or if ambient shaded air temperature is less than 10 degrees Celsius
○ No sealing if rain is forecast within 12 hours
FREQUENCY - Minimum 24 hours prior to sealing
○ Weather forecast and air temperature checked
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Review (NZTA Inspection Point)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - TNZ B/2 7.8 & B/5 7.10 Surface Finish
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Pre-seal Handover Sheet
○ Sealing ITP aligns with agreed treatment selection & design
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Monitor
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Sealing ITP completed & Chipseal Site Report (daily) submitted)
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Sealing ITP and Daily Reports
DETAIL - Confirming roadmarking set out as per directions from Asset Management Team, and then mark it out
FREQUENCY - After sealing complete and site has been swept
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Visual Inspection
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - This ITP Signed
DETAIL - Confirming roadmarking undertaken in accordance with the Pavement marking ITP
FREQUENCY - After roadmarking has been set out and marked up
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Check Pavement Marking ITP and associated QA complete
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - Pavement Marking ITP & associated QA completed
DETAIL - Tidy up site, remove all stockpiles and rubbish. Clean out grass verges, swales, kerb and channel, culverts and remove any environmental proteciton and survey pegs.
FREQUENCY - After sealing complete and site has been swept
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Visual inspection
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - This ITP signed
DETAIL - Test results, checklists, delivery dockets and other quality records to be included within Quality Management folder on contract workspace
FREQUENCY - At completion of surfacing and after all test results received
INSPECTION / TEST METHOD (submission, design, visual inspection, testing, measure, review) - Document Review
QUALITY EVIDENCE (signed, test results or records) - This ITP Signed
Approved as complete (Project / Site / Quality Engineer):
